intro: Syngonanthus xeranthemoides var. tricostatus, commonly known as the tricostate sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in late summer. It thrives in wet or moist habitats such as marshes and stream banks. Its distinctive features include the tricostate (three-ribbed) texture of its leaves, which contribute to its scientific name.
